inn1.comm: short, pulled into the ground behind square leg and Watson's off the mark first ball
bouncer, flies through as the batsman ducks
length, on off and defended down the wicket
short, attacking the batsman's body, dropped into the on side
length, seaming in and taking a chunk of bat before hitting the pad and rolling to midwicket
length ball outside off and Watson's shoulders arms
full, swinging in a touch and driven to mid-off
full again, swinging in before seaming a touch, beating Warner's attempted glance. Very close that
length, pushed towards cover
angled across and driven wide of the cover fielder
slightly full, on off and punched through the leg side
length, prodded into the on side
short, Warner goes back on his toes and cuts to the man at point
thumps into Warner's pad as he chopped down on the ball - but it pitched outside leg
slanted across and dabbed to point again
length and beats the outside edge, Warner slashing like a horror movie bad guy
on the legs and nudged square to the fielder
short, hooked off his hips, again to the fielder, who tries to throw down the non-striker's end
bit of width and Watson leans into a lazy, picture-perfect cover drive to the sweeper on the boundary
leg-stump line, tucked up but manages to squeeze the ball between square leg and midwicket for a couple
full, driven in the air, just dying on the fielder, Johnson Charles, as he dived for what would have been a spectacular catch
short and hooked powerfully over midwicket - a sign of attacking intent from Warner
length, outside off and angling across, driven on the bounce to cover-point
defended into the off side
length, on the stumps, defended
bit of room outside off and driven through a gap in the covers
length, cut behind square
angled in from wide of the stumps, defended on the front foot
defended on the stumps
defended to third man, an aborted run nearly has Watson in trouble
length, tight off-stump line, defended
full, driven square and a misfield sees the ball slip through at point before being reined in near the boundary
good length, outside off and driven to cover where Sammy catches on the bounce
outside off, prodded to cover again
angled in, seaming a touch and chopped back to the bowler with Watson coming forward
forward defensive back to the bowler
defended on the stumps

bowled him! The delivery was back of a length but shot through low, clipping Warner's pad as he tried to play back before rattling into the stumps halfway up. The batsman was done by the bounce (or lack thereof) - but he had already misjudged a couple of deliveries like that today
pitched up, outside off, left by Forrest
full length again, driven to cover
forward and clipped to point
another one gone! Roach lures Forrest into a jab outside off, the bat well away from his body, and a thick edge is safely pouched by second slip
loose ball, short and with room outside off for Watson to muscle the ball to the boundary between deep point and third man
tighter line, defended into the on side
width again but this time Watson cuts in front of point and the man in the deep fields
down the leg side, Bravo losing his radar
angled across and dabbed to third man
length, chopped to the fielder in the covers
maintains a tighter line and Watson plays with a straight bat
length, angled across the left-handed Hussey, defended on to the wicket
bouncer, Hussey sways underneath
on the stumps, length ball, prodded short on the off side
length, defended to the bowler
short of a length, played off the back foot to point
beats the bat outside off - there's a sound but seems like it was bat against pad
length, on off, defended
on the legs, turned around the corner
slanted across and worked to third man
length, defended to the leg side
shot! Sammy was a fraction short and Watson seized on it like a prizefighter spotting a gap in his opponent's guard, swinging an uppercut over the deep midwicket fence for a Dorothy
driven square on the off side
tight line, played towards mid-on
back of a length, but too close to the body for Watson to cut, his shot dobbling to the fielder
room to swing his arms again and Watson cuts past point
short and quick this time from Russell, causing Watson to drop his hands as the ball whistles through
on the stumps, defended
full, angled in and glanced hard but straight to midwicket
leg-stump line to the left-hander, turned to midwicket
full, flicked off the pads down to long leg
slower, looping delivery, Watson leans into a push to cover
room outside off and tickled past the dive of the man at short-third man
outside leg stump and punched for another single
tempting length outside off and beats Watson's expansive drive past the inside edge
touch short and the ball rears and seams further away from Hussey, who drops his hands and keeps out of the way
fuller ball and driven square, one run pinched despite Pollard's diving stop in the gully
flicked off the pads to deep square
full, on the stumps, driven to mid-off
drops short, tucked square off his body
length, Hussey pushes forward defensively, fielded by mid-off
length, swinging away slightly and deflected down to third man
full ball, punched down the ground for one
on the pads, clipped to deep backward square
slower ball on leg stump, Hussey brings his bat down on it
speared across and pushed behind point, playing back

Watson falls to the slower ball! Sammy rolled it out of the hand again - though it almost turned into a full toss - and Watson's clip flew off the toe of the bat to Devendra Bishoo, the substitute fielder, who took a low catch at midwicket
down the leg side and pulled round the corner
short ball and the batsman leans back out of the way
length, on the stumps and half-driven towards mid-on
full, on the stumps and defended
length delivery, outside off but played to cover on the back foot
pitched up, on the stumps again and defended
full, played into the leg side
cut hard, fielded on the bounce at point. Or was that a drop? Yes, it flew straight to Pollard but he couldn't hold on to it falling back
short of a length, played square off the back foot
defended on the back foot
tight line, guided from just outside off down to third man
full, defended via a pad
played towards mid-on and they scramble a single
shoots through low outside off, just missing the stumps before spinning away off Baugh's legs
length, rears up and Hussey drops it short for another dash
outside off, goes back and drives through cover-point
length, driven square where Pollard fields energetically
outside leg and flipped off his hips by the batsman
full off-break, Hussey lets it go past
tossed up, spinning away again and Hussey tucks his bat behind his pad
beautiful length, pitching around middle and turning past the outside edge as Hussey pushed forward uncertainly
shorter, cut to the man at point
flighted, Hussey goes back and leaves
tossed up well outside off and turning further, Hussey missing with a swipe - so Narine starts with an impressive maiden
short and wide, David Hussey cuts in the air over point for a one-bounce four
tighter line, played back to the bowler
played down the ground and David sends Michael back - just as well, as the throw at the non-striker's end was a direct hit
played towards the man at cover
full, worked off the pads to midwicket
shorter but the cut shot comes off the bottom edge and bounces to cover
swept behind square for a couple
tossed up outside off and left
on the stumps, prodded back
full, on off and Michael Hussey picks him up quickly to loft the ball over deep midwicket - lovely timing
drops shorter, dabbed towards third man
length, possibly a carrom ball and a leading edge drops short of the bowler
good length and straight, David Hussey blocks
played off the back foot towards gully
tight line and length, around middle, Michael Hussey blocks
the slower offbreak kicks off a good length and rises on Hussey, who sways and lets it go
he thought about pulling that one as it swerved away from him but let it go in the end
played off the pads behind square for a quick single, that was the only run in the over
cut off the back foot to short third man
Michael Hussey goes back and pushes the ball into the gap at point
pushed through quick and straight, David Hussey defends on the leg side
steered from the crease towards point, Narine's allowing no room
defended on the front foot, that spun into the right-hander
defended on the front foot once again, another one-run over
short of a length around off stump, cut off the back foot through point, the ball's not coming on to the bat off this pitch so he's just working the singles at the moment
short ball and it's been pulled towards the fielder to the deep square boundary
driven firmly off the front foot but Samuels dives to his left at extra cover to save runs
Bravo dives at point but can't prevent the single after the ball was cut towards him
far more singles in this Pollard over, this one is towards cover
good length outside off, played off the back foot towards backward point
Narine spins the offbreak into the right-hand batsman, Hussey tries to turn it off his pads but doesn't make proper contact
he's hit this one well, the one that spins the other way is a bit short outside off and Hussey uses the room to go back and cut hard through backward point
Hussey strides forward and outside the line of off stump to defend, the ball spun back into him and hit the pad
he's been caught behind! Narine bowled it quicker and pitched it fuller, Hussey came forward to drive and edged it as the ball spun across him. Baugh took a sharp catch. He had little reaction time.
there's an appeal after the man at backward short leg catches the ball but it came off the pad as Bailey tried to defend
fuller and wider outside off stump, Bailey drives firmly but the shot is blocked at short cover
played through square leg off the front foot
pushed off the front foot to long-off
that one shoots through at shin height after pitching short of a length, Bailey tries to defend on the back foot and is beaten close to off stump
another one keeps low off a length that's a bit fuller, Bailey gets beaten once again
steered towards third man with an open face
short of a length angling into the right-hander, played with soft hands close on the off side
Hussey goes back and works the flat ball off his pads behind square
that's a long hop which spins into Bailey, he pulls but can't beat the man at square leg
played to square leg again, Hussey thinks about the single but has to hurry back
played behind square this time for a single
glanced off the pads towards fine leg where Russell fields
that's too short again and Bailey pulls, this time beating the fielder at square leg by placing it behind him and to the boundary
good length but the line is too straight, glanced off the pads to fine leg
too full and wide outside off, Bailey has room to drive and he plays a flowing one, placing it through the gap at cover
glanced with an open face to third man
short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot, giving third man more work
Narine has to run again at third man after another one goes in his direction
short of a length but wide outside off, Hussey tries to pull, dragging it with the bottom of his bat to midwicket
Bailey works the ball off his pads towards fine leg
Bailey pushes forward and opens the face to steer the ball past short third man
defended on the front foot towards the off side
bowled flat and straight, the batsman goes back and punches to long-on
Hussey tries to cut off the back foot but mis-times the shot to the bowler
defended on the back foot, Samuels pushed that through quicker
length ball on off and middle, pushed towards mid-on but the fielder at midwicket cuts it off
defended from the crease to the man at midwicket
that's too full and on the pads, Bailey glances to Powell on the fine leg boundary
good length angling into off stump, Hussey gets behind the line and defends
the slower ball bowled on a fuller length, Hussey leans forward and flicks behind square
played off the back foot towards square once again, the length was good but the line a bit straight
played back to the bowler on the front foot
that's wide down leg side, Baugh lunges to his left and flicks the ball back on to the stumps, Bailey had lost balance after trying to pull, but managed to keep his foot grounded
defended on the off side
Bailey moves forward and drives to long-on
flicked off the front foot through square leg
defended on the front foot to the bowler
Bailey's flicked that in the air but wide of the fielder diving to his right at midwicket
caught at point! Bailey's cut the slower ball straight to the fielder. Bravo pitched it short of a length outside off and got the ball to bounce a bit more - tennis-ball type bounce
a fuller and quicker ball angling into the right-hander, Christian comes forward to block but gets an inside edge behind square
length ball angling into off stump, Christian drives from his crease to point
that's a slower half-volley outside off, Hussey has room to free his arms and he swings hard off the front foot, launching it flat towards the long-off boundary
the short ball and Hussey sways out of the way
good length angling into off and middle, Hussey drives from his crease to extra cover
Christian strides forward to block but misses, the ball hits his arm and then goes on to the pad
pushed off the front foot towards cover point
Hussey moves forward and closes the face to play on the leg side, he too doesn't make contact
driven off the front foot towards long-on
big turn into the right-hander, Christian tried to cut but was cramped for room
played towards long-on off the front foot
good length around off and middle stump, defended on the leg side from the crease
length ball outside off stump, played off the front foot towards point
Christian tries to pull a ball that is too full and misses, getting hit high on the front pad
the slower ball cuts into the right-hander from outside off, Christian dabs on the off side and runs
fuller length around off stump, Hussey drives to cover
that's too full and too close to off stump for the late cut and Hussey was beaten
played towards mid-on off the front foot
lots of turn into the right-hander but the ball ends up on the pads, allowing the batsman to work it behind square
forced off the back foot towards long-on

Christian's been run out! Hussey worked the ball towards square and set off, then hesitated a little, and set off again. Roach was quick to reach the ball from short fine leg and threw to the keeper, who broke the stumps with Christian well out of his ground
defended on the front foot towards point, he's survived his first ball today
played off the back foot to short third man
full ball on the pads, flicked behind square
Roach is looking for the yorker, not getting the length right, Hussey plays the ball from off stump towards mid-on
Roach hits the pads and appeals but that pitched outside leg stump, Wade moved across to play on the leg side and missed the glance
good length angling across the left-hand batsman, Wade pushes towards cover on the front foot
a full toss this time, easier for Wade to flick off his pads through square, Sammy chases and slides
another full toss, but Hussey can only play it back to the bowler
full ball outside off, driven from the crease through cover
played back to the bowler on the back foot
Hussey strides on to the front foot, gets down on one knee and sweeps with power, Charles runs to his right on the deep square leg boundary and dives to save the four
defended on the back foot
played off the front foot in front of square, Bravo sprints to his left and dives to field
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Roach fires the ball into the blockhole, Hussey whips it towards short fine leg
a low full toss on off stump, Hussey backs away towards leg and hits it to cover
the slower ball outside off, Hussey makes room to cut and hits it behind point, he waited a moment and then executed the shot superbly
played to mid-off for a quick single
another one nearly in the blockhole, Wade flicks it to square leg, Roach had over-stepped, though, so there's a free-hit coming up
the free-hit is also in the blockhole, Wade can only dig it out towards mid-off
in the blockhole outside off stump, Hussey tries to play through point and is beaten
Wade lunged on to the front foot and tried to slog sweep, top-edging the ball in the air to Roach at square leg
played off the back foot to square leg
bowled him! Two in the over. Hussey went back to cut and the ball spun back into him, inducing the bottom edge on to the stumps
spooned in the air but short of the fielder at mid-off
that's a ripper, the ball that spins the other way, it drifted into the right-hander, pitched on middle and spun past off, a left-arm spinner would have been proud
played to point for a very quick single
short of a length angling into McKay, who played it awkwardly behind square
a full toss, Lee punches it towards his team-mate and the ball hits the non-striker
Lee backs away to make room and cut, getting a bottom edge past his stumps to the keeper
short ball and Lee swings, pulling the ball with power to deep square leg, the throw is wide from Darren Bravo to the keeper and that allows the third
McKay backs away and swings a full ball towards wide mid-on, Dwayne Bravo dives to his right and takes pace off the ball
backs away and hits it with a flat bat over cover
that's a huge hit! Lee's stepped out of his crease, got to the pitch of the ball, and lofted it far over the long-on boundary with a full and free swing of his bat
will he be caught here? No. It's just out of the reach of Kieran Powell, who ran back from mid-off and dived full length. Lee had backed away and mis-timed the loft down the ground
Lee backs away outside leg and then tries to hit through midwicket. He misses and the ball goes between body and leg stump and beats the keeper
McKay's been stumped. He charged out of his crease and swung hard, the flat and quicker ball sped past the bat, and Baugh had an easy job to do
Doherty aims for the slog down the ground and makes no contact

Doherty moves forward and swings at the ball, he gets beaten by the turn away from him and Baugh whips off the bails. Has Doherty been stumped? No, the back foot was grounded. Narine finishes with 4 for 27

inn2.comm: that's an abysmal leave! Lee's first ball is straight, on a good length and Powell shoulders arms! He's stuck in his crease, smack bang in front and that's the easiest decision Gregory Brathwaite has ever had to make, I imagine. What a start - West Indies aren't going to make this easy, are they?
short, rearing outside off and thumping into a gloved hand
length and left by Samuels, shuffling across
on the stumps, played back, patting the ball down short on the leg side
back of a length, defended
fuller, quicker, on off and defended, the batsman right behind it - though he's not too sure where the ball ended up
length, outside off and Charles tries to leave, the ball unintentionally thunking off the face of the bat and scooting down to third man
comes forward and pushes a defensive shot into the off side
nagging length, nudged behind point for a couple
good length, on the stumps and played down on to the wicket
again defended on a length outside off, the bat scissoring down from point
tight line and length from McKay, defended into the leg side
targeting the stumps, slightly short and worked towards midwicket
fuller, room to drive outside off and steals a single wide of mid-off
stays back and defends
fullish, played on the back foot down to third man
tight line, quick and straight, jabbed to point
full ball, angling in, driven to mid-on, unable to get much on the shot
on the stumps, defended
full ball, nudged down the ground
width for Samuels, who smashes the ball towards point, where it's well fielded
full length, Samuels steps outside off and leaves
pitched up and driven square but can't beat Dan Christian at cover-point
straighter, turned into the leg side and the batsmen change their minds about a run - maiden for McKay
yorker right on the stumps and Charles does well to slam his bat down on it
strays down the leg side and neatly flicked to the boundary by the batsman
angled towards leg again and Charles clips wristily, McKay's diving stop preventing another boundary
full, leg-stump line and squeezed fine for four more - Lee's not really bowling to his field here
full, straight, tickled behind square leg again
edged ... but the ball dies on its way through to Wade. Better line from Lee but that was a profitable over for West Indies
on the stumps, solid defensive
length, on off and straightening, defended with a straight bat
given room outside off to swing his arms and Charles hammers a drive over mid-off and away to the rope
fuller, driven hard square but can't beat the infield
in the corridor outside off and punched to cover
length ball, Charles nudges it to short extra-cover and again there's no run
length, nudged into the on side
back of a length, played from deep in the crease down to third man
a mighty swoosh of the arms and the white ball disappears over long-on and into the crowd! "Smoked him" as Tony Cozier aptly comments

another big swing, the ball goes up, up up and away ... but where to? Johnson's top-edge flew to third man, where Xavier Doherty took a catch diving over the rope, then threw the ball back into play before landing - it'll go down as a dropped catch but that was a fantastic piece of fielding!
shorter ball, defended
pitched up, driven square
length, on the stumps, played to midwicket
angled towards leg and clipped to backward square
tempting line and length, draws Samuels forward and beats the outside edge
pitched up, turned round the corner to fine leg
full, played into the off side
length ball, driven back to the bowler
on the stumps, defended
slightly full, on the pads and tucked square, the batsmen running hard for a couple
outside off, leaps from a good length and played awkwardly down towards point
length, deflected towards point and the batsman is sent back, scrambling to beat the fielder's throw
fuller, deflected to third man
pitched on a length, outside off and jabbed to cover
full, on the stumps, driven through cover
clipped off the legs towards deep midwicket
tossed up on leg stump and driven emphatically straight down the ground, beating the man running round from long-on
flatter, on the legs and tickled square
full, on the legs and swept fine, reeled in by the rope
darted towards leg stump, turned into a gap in front of square
tight line, defended in his crease on off stump
full ball ... yorked him! Looked like Watson might have rolled that out the back of the hand but Samuels played over the top of the ball and the bails pinged into the air as if popped from a toaster
length, outside off and pushed towards cover
fuller delivery, driven from just outside off, can't beat the infield
that one gets through! Big backlift from Bravo and punched past the diving fielder in the covers, the ball racing away - super timing
around the wicket and defended on the back foot
length, on the stumps and patted back to the bowler
quicker ball, outside off, beats an attempted cut
on the stumps, defended on the leg side
flighted, still bowling around the wicket, driven from in front of off down the ground
bit more air and defended to point
flatter, quicker, outside off and allowed to go through to the keeper
full ball, driven hard but collected smartly by cover-point
slower ball, on leg stump and ticked into the gap
around the wicket to Bravo, full delivery, driven to mid-on
tight line on off stump, scrambled seam - defended on the front foot

terrible calling but somehow Charles survives! Bravo pushed to mid-on, called for the run then changed his mind, leaving Charles stranded - but the two Aussie fielders, one of them the bowler Watson, left it to each other to complete the stumping. The throw went between the two of them!
defended towards the leg side
oooh! What happened there? Hussey turned one back through Charles, beating the bat, flying over the stumps, past the keeper and running away for byes. Hussey clasps his head in his hands!
on the stumps, gets behind this one
driven out through the cover area
short, played on the back foot to third man
fuller ball, driven out to deep backward point
down the leg side and misses with the sweep
flat, defended on the stumps
slanted down the leg side - another extra to the West Indies total
fuller, straighter, driven to long-on
pitched up, driven into the ground back to the bowler
full, defended on the stumps
overpitched, Bravo swings heartily, smashing a laser-guided cover drive to the rope
and again! Not such a sweet connection but the ball skitters aways quickly enough through extra cover
on the legs and flicked away for a single
Wade is up to the stumps, Bravo defends on the front foot
touch shorter, room to cut through point
length ball, takes the pace off it, jabbed short on the leg side, off the splice
rears off a length, dropped into the leg side again

more calamitous running and Charles has run out of lives! He chopped Christian to third man, then tried to take a second off a misfield - Bravo yelled and yelled "No!" but Charles was halfway down the wicket before he realised his partner wasn't leaving his crease. Christian did the honours at the non-striker's end
around the wicket, pushed to mid-on
defended on the front foot
Doherty rips the ball past the outside edge of the forward defence
played off the pads towards square leg for a single
Darren thrusts forward to defend and gets bat and pad on the leg side
goes for the big cover drive but ends up hitting the ball on to the pad off the inside edge
comes forward to block but misses the ball and is hit on the pad by the turn into the left-hand batsman
good length and straight, played from the crease behind square
good length angling into the left-hander from round the wicket, defended from the crease
Bravo drives away from his body and edges an outside edge to third man
good length and straight, defended on the front foot
punched off the back foot towards cover
length ball outside off, Bravo plants his foot forward and has a real go, he wanted to blast that through the off side but was beaten instead, he's missed a few of those
defended on the front foot on the off side
full ball on the pads, Dwayne Bravo moves forward and flicks along the ground to deep midwicket
tossed up from round the wicket into off and middle, driven through cover

this was inevitable. Darren Bravo has been bowled off the inisde edge trying to drive the ball through cover. Doherty tossed the ball up outside off stump from round the wicket, drawing the batsmen into driving away from his body. Bravo reached for the ball, leaving a gap between bat and pad. The ball spun into the left-hander, hit the inside edge and hit the stumps
defended on the front foot to the man at silly point, a slightly deep silly point
played off the pads behind square, a little hesitation between the wickets
good length and straight, defended from the crease
played off the back foot towards point
Pollard tries to play towards square but ends up pushing it towards the bowler
Pollard stays on the back foot and pushes the ball in the air but well short of mid-off
Pollard stays in his crease and blocks once again, towards the bowler
after five dot balls, Christian drops one short and Pollard is quick to capitalise, staying back and heaving the ball over the midwicket boundary
Doherty spins the ball sharply away from the right-hander after pitching outside off, Bravo lets it go
defended on the front foot
Bravo strides forward and pushes towards long off
Pollard strides forward to defend but gets beaten by the turn away from him
defended from the crease towards the off side
driven from the crease to long off for a single
full and straight, flicked towards midwicket where the fielder fails to stop the ball with a dive
clipped off the pads through square leg
defended on the leg side
good length on off stump, Pollard defends from his crease
that's pretty satisfying for West Indies. Pollard has room outside off to free his arms and he swings with a lot of power, lofting the length ball over the extra cover boundary
played towards square leg for a single
Bravo strides forward and defends as the ball spins across him from round the wicket, he plays towards short third man for a single
Pollard stays in his crease and dead-bats the ball on the off side
Pollard carts Doherty back over his head for his third six, he didn't get to the pitch of the ball, but just smacked it as it turned across him
driven with power from the crease through the off side
Pollard plays the ball through square leg, off his pads
played off the back foot through cover
steered from the crease towards third man
defended from the crease on the off side
Pollard drives with so much power that the ball bursts through Watson at mid-off
forced off the back foot through midwicket, there's a fielder in the deep
good length and straight, Bravo defends after getting behind the line
Bravo stays back and opens the face to run a length ball to third man
played off the front foot with an open face towards third man
a full toss on the pads, Pollard plays it to deep square leg
good length on off stump, Bravo defends on the front foot
shot! Bravo's blazed a full ball through point with a square drive that's dripping with flair - a high back lift and a flowing follow-through of the bat
played off the hips behind square
short of a length outside off, the ball climbs on Pollard, who lets it go
length ball on middle and leg, Bravo moves across his stumps and glances towards fine leg
Pollard plays back to a length ball that nips into him and gets hit high on the pad
length ball angling into the right-hander, Pollard plays from his crease and drives the ball through midwicket
short of a length outside off, Bravo cuts from his crease, placing it far enough towards third man's right to run the second

a loud appeal for lbw but umpire Tarapore says not out. Australia have asked for a review. Bravo thrust forward while trying to defend and got hit on the knee roll by one that nipped back into the right-hander. The impact on the pad was outside off stump, though, so Bravo will remain not out. Australia have used up their review.
Bravo tries to cut a slower ball from a good length and is beaten
short of a length and straight, Pollard defends on the leg side and wants one, Bravo did not because Bailey from midwicket had come sprinting in and dived
full ball on middle stump, played towards Bailey at midwicket
that is a well-directed bouncer, right at Pollard's head, the batsman ducks under it
played off the back foot towards midwicket, Lee's keeping the length on the shorter side, not letting Pollard get underneath any
worked off the pads behind square and Pollard covers the pitch easily with long strides to return for the second
another fast short ball that has Pollard ducking in a hurry to avoid wearing it on his helmet
the slower ball on a good length outside off, Bravo comes forward and defends to cover
good length and straight, Bravo moves towards the off to get behind the line and blocks
Bravo thrusts his pad outside off stump and shoulders arms, the ball comes into the right-hander and hits the pad but it wasn't doing enough to hit off stump
defended on the front foot towards midwicket
the yorker, but Bravo manages to play it towards midwicket, the throw hits the stumps at the striker's end and they run an overthrow for the ricochet
defended from the crease towards the bowler
Bravo strides forward and defends, there's a slip in place
driven with power off the back foot towards the cover boundary, where a tandem effort saves the four
Bravo comes forward and lofts the ball towards the long-on boundary for a one-bounce four. That brings up the 50 run stand as well
defended on the front foot
cut off the back foot towards backward point
Bravo strides forward and blocks
that nipped back sharply into the right-hander, hitting Pollard on the thigh pad, the ball bobbed up wide of off stump and Wade lunged for it, but I don't think there was any bat on that
defended from the crease towards point
that's slow and wide outside off stump, delivered from the back of the hand with an upright seam, the batsman chases it and drives, but gets beaten
full and straight, swinging into the blockhole, dug out towards mid-on
driven on the front foot towards cover
length ball on he pads, Bravo leans across and clips through midwicket
Pollard goes back and cuts hard in front of point
defended on the front foot on the off side
Bravo tries to defend on the front foot but gets beaten by the turn away from him
Bravo applauds after completing a very quick single, Pollard had responded immediately after Bravo pushed towards cover
chipped towards long-on for a single, someone shouted "catch," but the ball dropped well short of the fielder
defended on the off side
cut off the back foot towards point, the keeper is standing up to the stumps
another back of the hand slower ball outside off, Pollard lets it go this time, he had chased the previous one and was beaten
Pollard tries to cut a length ball outside off and misses, Wade does not collect cleanly
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
defended from the crease on the leg side, wicket to wicket line on a good length from McKay
Pollard tries to drive from his crease at one that's not full enough and gets beaten outside off stump
Bravo comes forward and blocks
Bravo goes for the expansive cover drive and gets beaten bu the turn away from him
left alone outside off stump as the ball spins away from him
driven through cover for a single

that's a monstrous hit, it's out of the ground, the ball bounced on the roof and disappeared. Pollard cleared his front foot and swung hard, sending the ball far over midwicket, see you later. They need a new ball.
Pollard tries to blast down the ground but mis-hits it to midwicket
good length and straight, Bravo gets behind the line and defends

Bravo's been run out! He pushed the ball close on the off side and set off immediately, Pollard did not respond because the ball was around the silly point area and Wade, who was standing up to the stumps, had got to it in a flash. By the time Bravo turned around, Wade was already running back to the stumps, his underarm throw on the dive hit its target with Bravo well short
defended on the front foot towards point
good length outside off, Baugh lets it go
good length and straight, defended on the back foot
Baugh gets behind the line and defends
short of a length and straight, defended from the crease on the leg side. Lee won't be giving Pollard too much in his half
short of a length again, defended on the off side this time
played watchfully towards cover from the crease once again, the length isn't full
short of a length outside off, Pollard pushes to point and runs, and then screams for Baugh not to run, I don't think Baugh was going anywhere
the attempted yorker ends up as a full toss on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg
good length outside off, Baugh defends on the off side
tight on the stumps, nudged on the leg side
length, defended on the back foot
slower ball with a scrambled seam, outside off and Baugh swishes and misses
edged! But it bounces in front of the cordon and between slip and the keeper
tight line, punched to cover
room outside off to swing his arms and Pollard chops down to third man
short, pulled from outside off to deep square leg, Pollard's bottom hand coming off the bat in the process of executing the shot
length, outside off and Baugh stays back, pats towards point
drops short and steered down to third man
short ball, Pollard rides the bounce and though it clips the gloves the ball falls short of Wade
clipped to deep backward square
a crucial boundary? Lee dropps short again and Baugh hooks the ball over his shoulder and away for four
length, poked out towards cover-point
room outside off for Baugh to have a swing, which misses by a mile
fuller delivery, dug out to mid-off
pitched up and swung over midwicket for a couple. Not a clean connection but he did enough to clear the infield
hacked into the off side - and there's an appeal for a run out after a direct hit at the non-striker's end. Pollard was back though
full ball and Baugh steps back, launching an expansive drive over cover - surely that's the clincher?
length, punched to long-off
there she goes! Baugh swings a huge six over deep midwicket and West Indies have beaten Australia!
